input_sentence: ego vehicle is on the road and there is a continuous line present on the road, then the ego vehicle must not cross or straddle the continuous line.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is on the road
Continuous line is present on the road
Ego vehicle crosses the continuous line
Ego vehicle straddles the continuous line

temporal_relations.description: If ego is on road and continuous line is present, then ego must not cross or straddle the line

lexicon.ego_on_road: Ego vehicle is on the road
lexicon.line_present: Continuous line is present on the road
lexicon.ego_crosses: Ego vehicle crosses the continuous line
lexicon.ego_straddles: Ego vehicle straddles the continuous line

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_line → continuous_line  
   - obj_road → road

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: on_road(ego,road) [ego on road]
   - ap_2: present_on_road(continuous_line,road) [continuous line present on road]
   - ap_3: crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) [ego crosses continuous line]
   - ap_4: straddles_line(ego,continuous_line) [ego straddles continuous line]

3. Apply logical operators from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: on_road(ego,road) & present_on_road(continuous_line,road)
   - Consequent: ~(crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) | straddles_line(ego,continuous_line))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G((on_road(ego,road) & present_on_road(continuous_line,road)) -> ~(crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) | straddles_line(ego,continuous_line)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_line → continuous_line  
   - obj_road → road

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: on_road(ego,road) [ego on road]
   - ap_2: present_on_road(continuous_line,road) [continuous line present on road]
   - ap_3: crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) [ego crosses continuous line]
   - ap_4: straddles_line(ego,continuous_line) [ego straddles continuous line]

3. Apply logical operators from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: on_road(ego,road) & present_on_road(continuous_line,road)
   - Consequent: ~(crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) | straddles_line(ego,continuous_line))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
[The formula uses a global operator G to express a continuous requirement. The main structure is an implication where the premise combines two conditions using logical AND (&): on_road(ego,road) and present_on_road(continuous_line,road). The conclusion is a negation (~) of a disjunction (|) between crosses_line(ego,continuous_line) and straddles_line(ego,continuous_line).

For predicate interpretation:
- on_road(ego,road): "ego vehicle is on the road" (unary predicate with explicit object)
- present_on_road(continuous_line,road): "continuous line is present on the road" (relational predicate)
- crosses_line(ego,continuous_line): "ego vehicle crosses the continuous line" (relational predicate)
- straddles_line(ego,continuous_line): "ego vehicle straddles the continuous line" (relational predicate)

The logical structure translates to: Always, if both conditions are true, then neither of the prohibited actions should occur.]

Natural Language Translation:
[Always, if the ego vehicle is on the road and a continuous line is present on the road, then the ego vehicle must not cross the continuous line or straddle the continuous line.]

verification_result.back_translation: [Always, if the ego vehicle is on the road and a continuous line is present on the road, then the ego vehicle must not cross the continuous line or straddle the continuous line.]

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
